question: Which of the following clearly define Lineage?
option1: A straight line joining any two points on the globe
option2: The line of descendants of a particular ancestor
answer: The line of descendants of a particular ancestor
explanation: A lineage is a single line of descent or linear chain within the tree while a clade is a monophyletic group, containing a single ancestor and all its descendants. Phylogenetic trees are typically created from DNA, RNA or protein sequence data.
